definition: home of respect for aged/nursing home

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough

sentences.english: I hope the people at the nursing home appreciate you.
sentences.chinese: 我希望敬老院的人会很欣赏你。

sentences.english: Person in charge on behalf of all elderly nursing home Youth League game of the sympathy expressed his thanks.
sentences.chinese: 敬老院负责人代表全体老人对局团委的慰问表示感谢。

sentences.english: Then, Chen Xiang and Tan Xiangxuan day, put candy snack to homes for the elderly.
sentences.chinese: 于是，陈响和谭香选了日子，提了点心糖果去敬老院。

sentences.english: The first time they visited Grandma in the nursing home, Eleanor wanted to cry.
sentences.chinese: 第一次去敬老院看望奶奶，埃莉诺直想哭。

sentences.english: Ceng Yin advised him to recognize the home money woman as mother.
sentences.chinese: 曾音就建议他去认敬老院的钱太婆为娘。

definition: old man or woman/the elderly/one's aged parents or grandparents
(of an elderly couple) husband or wife
"left-behind children", rural children whose parents have to make a living as migrant workers in distant urban areas, but cannot afford to keep the family with them
a family bereaved of its only child
empty nest/a home where the kids have grown up and moved out
to express sympathy, greetings, consolation etc
